wikipedia_page.main: General Henry Sinclair Horne, 1st Baron Horne,  (19 February 1861 – 14 August 1929) was a military officer in the British Army, most notable for his generalship during the First World War. He was the only British artillery officer to command an army in the war.

response: * August 14 – Henry Horne, 1st Baron Horne, British general (b. 1861)
* February 19 – Henry Horne, 1st Baron Horne, British general (d. 1929)
*1929: Gen. Sir Henry Horne, 1st Baron Horne, GCB, KCMG
*General Henry Horne, 1st Baron Horne (1861–1929), only British artillery officer to command an army in the First World War
* 19 February – Henry Horne, 1st Baron Horne, general (died 1929)
